show.title: Elf
show.headline: The best way to spread Christmas cheer

event.title: <show-title>Elf</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: With themed games, props, and singing loud for all to hear
event.description:
"Buddy the Elf, what's your favorite color?"

Don’t be a cotton-headed ninnymuggins this holiday season. Come out to Alamo Drafthouse and spread the cheer at this sugar-fueled, interactive holiday spectacular, packed with games, props, and, of course, singing loud for all to hear.

Bundle up for this celebration of one of the best holiday films ever made, period. Will Ferrell’s take on a North Pole elf trying to figure out Manhattan (“Watch out! The yellow ones don’t stop!”) just might be the funniest he’s ever been.

Our ELF Movie Party features all sorts of fun props, a gift "wrap off" before the film, and of course, your very own elf hat.

"Don’t be a cotton-headed ninnymuggins this holiday season. Come out to Alamo Drafthouse and spread the cheer at this sugar-fueled, interactive holiday spectacular, packed with games, props, and, of course, singing loud for all to hear.

Bundle up for this celebration of one of the best holiday films ever made, period. Will Ferrell’s take on a North Pole elf trying to figure out Manhattan (“Watch out! The yellow ones don’t stop!”) just might be the funniest he’s ever been.

Our ELF Movie Party features all sorts of fun props, a gift "wrap off" before the film, and of course, your very own elf hat.

event.title: <show-title>Babylon</show-title> <event-type-title>Costume Screening</event-type-title>
event.headline: Party like it's 1929 at a wild dress up screening
event.description: Dust off your sharpest double-breasted suits and glitziest flapper dresses for a chance to relive the wild, hedonistic days of 1920s Hollywood at our BABYLON Dress Up Screening. We encourage everyone to put on their finest period-appropriate outfits for what’s sure to be the hardest-partying film of the year. Dressing up isn’t required, but you just might be named “Worts Dressed” in the tabloids if you show up in jeans and a t-shirt. Be sure to hit the bar before or after the show for a martini or two with your fellow guests.

eventType.title: Costume Screening
eventType.headline: You don’t need an excuse to dress up. But now you have one.
eventType.description: From James Bond Black Tie screenings to DESPERATELY SEEKING SUSAN ‘80s bashes to STAR WARS cosplay parties, we’ve got all the excuses you need to live your fully-costumed truth.

show.title: Killer Klowns from Outer Space
show.headline: Horrific Harlequins with an appetite for close encounters!

posterImages.altText: Killer Klowns From Outer Space movie poster

event.title: <show-title>Killer Klowns from Outer Space</show-title>
event.headline: Horrific Harlequins with an appetite for close encounters!
event.description: The most forehead-exploding big-budget sci-fi/horror/comedy of the ‘80s, written and directed by the special effects wizards behind CRITTERS and the Large Marge monsterface scene from PEE-WEE’S BIG ADVENTURE. A circus tent-shaped meteor crashlands in the forest, releasing an army of neon-colored, face-painted intergalactic creatures who mummify humans in cotton candy cocoons and slurp their sweetened blood through crazy straws. These diabolical bozos mow through the populace using only the most entertaining means: invisible cars, carnivorous shadow puppets, popcorn blasters, decapitating boxing matches, hand-to-spinal-cord ventriloquism, and much, much more. The only people with the guts to stand up to these extraterrestrial sillybones are two kind-hearted teens and the horny local ice cream vendors. Watch for thundering man’s-man actor John Vernon as the homophobic small-town cop who just isn’t gonna put up with any of this space clown shit. All this topped off with a theme song by pioneering goofpunk band The Dickies. Not to be viewed by anyone who fears clowns or enjoying life. (Zack Carlson)

show.title: National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation
show.headline: Nothing but the best for the Griswold Family Christmas

landscapeHeroImage.altText: Beverly D'Angelo and Chevy Chase in National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation

portraitHeroImage.altText: Chevy Chase in National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation

posterImages.altText: National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation movie poster

event.title: <show-title>National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Celebrate the season like an honorary Griswold.
event.description:
No one knows how to do vacations like the Griswolds. Sure, their holidays are wild, chaotic, and often fraught with peril, but everyone’s family gatherings are a little stressful, aren’t they? Fortunately, you can just let Clark and the gang shoulder all that stress while you enjoy the ride at our CHRISTMAS VACATION Movie Party.

We’re giving it the full Movie Party treatment, with special props like pine tree air fresheners, yellow glowsticks, and ugly neckties to help you feel like you're an honorary Griswold. It’ll be more fun than a membership to the Jelly of the Month Club.

contentBlocks.paragraphs:

show.title: The Goonies
show.headline: Heyy yoouu guys!

landscapeHeroImage.altText: Corey Feldman, Sean Astin, Ke Huy Quan, and Jeff Cohen in The Goonies

event.title: <show-title>The Goonies</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Heyy yoouu guuyys! We're watching the Goonies!
event.description:
Let’s face it, THE GOONIES never gets old (and they never say “die”). With its endearing cast of quirky kids and a plot filled with swashbuckling adventure, it serves as the ultimate fantasy for anyone who feels stuck in the mundane humdrum of everyday life.

Now it’s your chance to be a Goonie. Join us for a rollicking movie party and we’ll give you everything you need to join the gang, including a pirate eye patch, a marble bag filled with pirate treasure, a bandana, and a fun-sized Baby Ruth, of course. And don’t worry, we won’t make you do the truffle shuffle to get in.

So, to everyone who ever wanted to be a Goonie (or for those of you meeting the Goonies for the very first time), join us as we escape into this daring, heartwarming story of lost treasure and enduring friendship.

marketStrings.value: The personal closed captioning device displays feature film dialogue and other audio in the form of English-language text for individuals who are deaf or hard of hearing.

The descriptive audio headset provides individuals who are blind or have low vision with an English-language narration of the details of the feature presentation that can't be understood by the soundtrack alone.

The assisted listening headset provides an amplified audio signal for those individuals who are hard of hearing. A 3.5mm headphone jack is available to drive hearing aids, neck loops, or cochlear implants.
You may not enter a movie after it has started. If you show up to your desired screening late, we will happily exchange your ticket for a different showtime or for a raincheck to a future show.

sessionAttributes.name: Brunch
sessionAttributes.description: Both our regular and Brunch menus are available at this screening. Arrive hungry.

sessionAttributes.name: Kid Friendly
sessionAttributes.description: Grab the fam and let the fun begin! Our Kid Friendly screenings include pre-show activity sheets and crayons, a relaxed noise policy, and kids menus. Ages 3+ welcome with a parent or guardian.
